explains: adj. 原始的；根本的；原生的

sentences.en: Twenty million years ago, Idaho was populated by dense primordial forest.
sentences.cn: 两千万年前，爱达荷州遍布着茂密的原始森林。

sentences.en: Twenty million years ago, Idaho was not the arid place it is now. Rather, it was warm and damp, populated by dense primordial forest.
sentences.cn: 2000万年前，爱达荷州不像现在这样干旱。确切地说，它那时温暖潮湿，生长着茂密的原始森林。

sentences.en: It is hypothesized that the primordial cloud of dust and gas from which all the planets are thought to have condensed had a composition somewhat similar to that of Jupiter.
sentences.cn: 据推测，所有行星都是由尘埃和气体组成的原始云团凝聚而成，其组成与木星的组成有些相似。
